definitions: having a particular type of tongue or tongue-like part
characterized by sharp, pointed, or cutting speech and verbal expression
examples: The forked-tongued snake slithered through the grass
The long-tongued anteater searched for insects in the log
Her sharp-tongued comments hurt everyone's feelings at dinner
The silver-tongued salesman convinced them to buy the product

definitions: having the effect of restoring health, vigor, or well-being to body or mind
relating to or producing normal firmness and tension in muscles or tissue
relating to or based on the first note of a musical scale
examples: The mountain air had a tonic effect on her health
A brisk walk can be tonic for your mood and energy
Regular exercise maintains good tonic muscle condition throughout life
The physical therapist assessed the patient's tonic muscle state
The composer returned to the tonic chord at the end
The melody resolves beautifully to its tonic home note

definitions: equipped with teeth or tooth-like structures for biting or chewing
having a jagged or serrated edge with regular projections like teeth
examples: The toothed whale hunted fish in the deep ocean
Many carnivorous dinosaurs were heavily toothed predators with sharp fangs
She used a toothed blade to cut through the material
The toothed gear mechanism worked smoothly in the machine

definitions: having no teeth due to loss, removal, or natural absence
lacking power, force, or effectiveness to achieve intended results or enforcement
examples: The toothless old dog could only eat soft food
The baby gave us a toothless smile before bedtime
The new regulations proved toothless without proper enforcement mechanisms
Critics called the reform bill toothless and purely symbolic

definitions: relating to matters of current interest, relevance, or immediate importance
designed for application to a particular part of the body surface
relating to or arranged by particular topics or subject matter
examples: The comedian's topical jokes referenced this week's news headlines
The magazine features topical articles about current political issues
The doctor prescribed a topical cream for the skin rash
Topical anesthetics numb only the surface area where applied
The conference organized topical sessions on different research themes
She arranged her notes in topical order for easy reference

definitions: not wearing clothing on the upper part of the body
having no upper barrier, roof, or maximum limit in height
examples: Some beaches in Europe allow topless sunbathing for women
The topless dancers performed at the nightclub on weekends
The convertible car looked sleek with its topless design
The topless tower seemed to stretch endlessly toward the sky

definitions: situated at the very top or highest point of something
having the highest rank, priority, or importance among all others
examples: The flag flew from the topmost branch of the tree
She placed the star on the topmost point of the Christmas tree
Safety remains our topmost concern during the construction project
The topmost priority is ensuring all students have learning materials

definitions: relating to the arrangement of physical features of an area including elevation
examples: The topographic map showed all the hills and valleys
Hikers rely on topographic information to plan safe routes

definitions: relating to the physical features of a place or region and their representation
relating to detailed description or representation of features in a particular area
examples: The topographical survey revealed the land's elevation changes precisely
Scientists created a topographical model of the ocean floor
The author's topographical description captured every detail of the landscape
The medical report included topographical mapping of the brain lesion

definitions: covered or decorated with something placed on the upper surface
exceeded in amount, degree, or achievement by reaching a higher level
examples: The chocolate-topped cupcakes were everyone's favorite dessert choice
Snow-topped mountains surrounded the peaceful valley on all sides
Sales topped last year's record by twenty percent this quarter
The temperature topped 100 degrees for three consecutive days

definitions: excellent, first-rate, or superior in quality or performance
examples: That was absolutely topping performance at the theater last night
She thought the new restaurant's food was simply topping

definitions: of the highest quality, excellence, or achievement level possible
examples: The service at this hotel is absolutely tops in the city
Her presentation skills are tops among all the team members

definitions: experiencing severe mental or physical suffering that causes great anguish
subjected to repeated harassment, annoyance, or persecution that causes distress
examples: The tormented artist expressed his pain through dark paintings
She looked tormented by guilt over her past decisions
The tormented village endured constant raids from enemy forces
He felt tormented by memories that wouldn't leave him alone

definitions: having been ripped, split, or damaged by pulling apart forcefully
experiencing emotional conflict between opposing feelings, choices, or loyalties
examples: Her torn jacket needed mending before she could wear it
The torn pages of the book were carefully taped together
He felt torn between his career ambitions and family obligations
She was torn about whether to accept the job offer

definitions: falling rapidly and in copious quantities like a violent rush of water
examples: Torrential rain flooded the streets within minutes of the storm
The torrential downpour made driving conditions extremely dangerous yesterday

definitions: very hot and dry with scorching or oppressive heat
full of passionate emotion, especially romantic or sexual intensity
full of difficulty, hardship, or unpleasant experiences
examples: The torrid desert climate made outdoor work nearly impossible
We endured another torrid summer with record-breaking temperatures
Their torrid love affair shocked the conservative community
The novel describes a torrid romance between the two characters
The team suffered through a torrid losing streak last season
It was a torrid time for the company during the recession

definitions: full of twists, turns, and bends in physical shape or path
excessively lengthy, complex, or convoluted in expression or argument
examples: The tortuous mountain road required careful driving around each bend
We followed a tortuous path through the dense jungle
His tortuous explanation only confused the audience more than before
The tortuous legal process took years to reach a conclusion

definitions: experiencing or showing signs of great physical or mental pain
strained, unnatural, or excessively complicated in form or expression
examples: His tortured expression revealed the depth of his suffering
The prisoner's tortured screams echoed through the dungeon walls
The writer's tortured prose made the simple story unnecessarily complex
Her tortured logic failed to convince anyone of her argument

definitions: inflicting severe physical or mental pain and suffering on someone
examples: The torturing heat of the desert sun was almost unbearable
Those torturing memories haunted him every night before sleep

definitions: completely wrecked or damaged beyond economical repair, especially a vehicle
calculated or added together to reach a sum or final amount
examples: The totaled car was towed away from the accident scene
After the storm, several boats lay totaled on the shore
The expenses totaled more than we had budgeted for renovation
When totaled together, the donations exceeded our fundraising goal

definitions: relating to a system of government that exercises complete control over citizens' lives
examples: The totalitarian regime controlled every aspect of daily life
Citizens lived in fear under the totalitarian government's oppressive rules

definitions: emotionally moved or affected by feelings of sympathy or gratitude
slightly affected by mental instability or considered mildly eccentric
examples: She was deeply touched by their thoughtful surprise birthday party
The touching tribute left everyone in the audience visibly touched
The old hermit was considered a bit touched by locals
People thought he was touched because of his strange habits

definitions: arousing feelings of sympathy, gratitude, or tender emotion
making physical contact or being immediately adjacent to something
examples: The touching reunion between mother and daughter brought tears
His touching speech about overcoming adversity inspired the graduates
The two buildings were so close they were almost touching
She noticed their hands were touching on the table

definitions: extremely tall or high, especially in comparison to surroundings
outstanding in importance, intensity, or degree above all others
examples: The towering skyscrapers dominated the city's impressive skyline view
Towering redwood trees stretched hundreds of feet into the sky
She was a towering figure in the civil rights movement
His towering rage frightened everyone in the room that day

definitions: relating to the branch of science concerned with poisons and their effects
examples: The toxicological report revealed high levels of mercury contamination
Scientists conducted toxicological studies on the new pharmaceutical compound

definitions: able to be found, discovered, or followed back to an origin or source
examples: The contamination was traceable to a specific factory upstream
All products are traceable through our barcode tracking system

definitions: relating to or affecting the trachea or windpipe in the respiratory system
examples: The patient required a tracheal tube to maintain breathing
The doctor examined her tracheal passages for signs of infection

definitions: followed, monitored, or recorded the movement or progress of something
equipped with tracks instead of wheels for movement over rough terrain
examples: The tracked package arrived exactly when the system predicted
Scientists tracked the migration patterns of birds using GPS
The tracked vehicle easily crossed the muddy construction site
Military tracked vehicles can traverse almost any terrain effectively

definitions: having no tracks, paths, or trails to follow through an area
examples: The explorers ventured into trackless wilderness never mapped before
The trackless desert stretched endlessly in all directions around them

definitions: easy to control, manage, or deal with in a cooperative way
capable of being easily shaped, molded, or worked with
examples: The normally tractable students became difficult during exam week
She preferred working with tractable clients who followed advice
The tractable metal could be formed into various artistic shapes
Clay becomes more tractable when mixed with the right amount of water

definitions: relating to or providing the adhesive friction needed for pulling or drawing
examples: The locomotive's tractive effort pulled twenty cars up the hill
Engineers calculated the tractive force needed for the heavy load

definitions: legally registered and protected as a trademark for exclusive use by owner
examples: The trademarked logo cannot be used without permission from corporate
Their trademarked slogan appears on all their product packaging

definitions: adhering to or favoring traditional beliefs, customs, and values over modern ones
examples: The traditionalist community resisted changes to their ancient customs
Her traditionalist views clashed with the progressive company culture

definitions: having been taught specific skills or behaviors through instruction and practice
developed, conditioned, or refined through repeated practice or cultivation
examples: The trained technician quickly diagnosed the computer problem
Only trained personnel should operate this dangerous equipment
His trained eye could spot fake paintings from across the room
Years of practice gave her a trained ear for music

definitions: guilty of or involving betrayal of trust, allegiance, or confidence
examples: His traitorous actions led to the defeat of his army
The traitorous employee sold company secrets to their competitors

definitions: free from disturbance, agitation, or commotion; calm and peaceful
examples: The tranquil lake reflected the mountains like a perfect mirror
She sought a tranquil place to meditate and clear her mind

definitions: crossing or extending across the Atlantic Ocean between continents
examples: The transatlantic flight from New York to London takes seven hours
Transatlantic trade agreements benefit both American and European markets

definitions: surpassing ordinary experience, understanding, or material existence
relating to spiritual or mystical experience beyond ordinary perception
examples: The artist aimed to create transcendent beauty in her work
His transcendent performance moved the audience beyond words
They sought transcendent wisdom through years of meditation practice
The mystic described transcendent visions during her spiritual journey

definitions: surpassing ordinary physical or empirical experience; spiritual or mystical
relating to transcendentalism or the philosophical study of intuitive knowledge
examples: The monks pursued transcendental meditation to achieve enlightenment
She described a transcendental experience during her near-death episode
His thesis explored transcendental philosophy and its modern applications
The transcendental movement influenced American literature profoundly

definitions: extending or traveling across a continent from one side to another
examples: The transcontinental railroad connected the Atlantic and Pacific coasts
They completed a transcontinental journey by car last summer

definitions: written down or typed from spoken words or another written source
converted into written notation, especially for music or phonetic representation
examples: The secretary transcribed notes from the recorded meeting yesterday
Court reporters transcribed every word spoken during the trial
The composer transcribed the folk melody for symphony orchestra
Linguists transcribed the endangered language using phonetic symbols

definitions: applied to or absorbed through the skin for systemic effect
examples: The transdermal patch delivers medication continuously through the skin
Transdermal nicotine patches help many people quit smoking successfully

definitions: capable of being moved, conveyed, or applied from one place, person, or situation to another
examples: These skills are transferable to many different career paths
The warranty is transferable to the next owner of the vehicle

definitions: changed completely in form, nature, function, or appearance
examples: The abandoned warehouse was transformed into luxury apartments
Her outlook on life was transformed after surviving the accident

definitions: denoting a person whose gender identity differs from their birth-assigned sex
examples: The transgender community advocates for equal rights and acceptance
She came out as transgender to her family last year

definitions: lasting only for a short time; temporary or impermanent
staying or working in a place for only a short time
examples: The transient nature of fame became clear to the actor
Spring flowers provide transient beauty that lasts only weeks
The hotel mainly serves transient business travelers during weekdays
Transient workers follow seasonal employment opportunities across regions

definitions: relating to or marking a period of change from one state to another
examples: The company hired a transitional CEO during the restructuring
This transitional period requires patience as we implement changes

definitions: not permanent or lasting; existing only briefly or temporarily
examples: Youth is transitory, so enjoy it while it lasts
The economic boom proved transitory when the bubble burst

definitions: relating to the process of translating from one language to another
relating to movement in which all parts move in the same direction
examples: The translational accuracy of the document was verified by experts
She studied translational techniques for literary works
The engineer analyzed the translational motion of the sliding mechanism
Translational kinetic energy depends on the object's mass and velocity

definitions: allowing light to pass through but diffusing it so objects cannot be seen clearly
examples: The translucent curtains provided privacy while letting in light
She admired the translucent wings of the dragonfly
